sentence: What could be nicer than sitting before an open window, enjoying nature, listening to the birds sing, feeling the sun on your cheeks and holding a darling boy in your arms?
(That’s the title of a movie with Dorit Kreysler, Ida Wüst and Harald Paulsen!)
I feel so peaceful and safe with his arm around me, knowing he’s near and yet not having to speak; how can this be bad when it does me so much good?
Oh, if only we were never disturbed again, not even by Mouschi.
